page.title: 17ELECTROLUX
page.content: Electrolux,founded in 1920,make vacuum cleaners and refridgerators.Part of the Swedish firm ABElectrolux,1800 people are employed,with 8/9 young people on Y.T.S schemes.Two thirds of the workers are men.Two shifts are worked,8.30 pm to 7.00 am,and 7.30 am to 5.00 pm.Some maintenance work takes place on Saturdays and Sundays;they have 5 weeks holiday a year.The Leagrave Factory is the largest in U.K and Electrolux products are known all over Europe.Also made are the "Flymo" lawn mowers.Plastic granules and parts come from I.C.I and metal parts from other Companies.There are teams of repair men all over the country who go into retail shops to mend broken appliances.Three unions operate in the factory;the last strike lasted 6 weeks and in the last redundancy,nearly 300 people lost their jobs.
